titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn studio portrait collection V1987.020
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:40-0500

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn studio portrait collection dates from circa 1875 to 1899 and contains 22 items. The collection is composed primarily of cabinet cards, with larger mounted photographs included. Studio portraits show individual men, women, and children, as well as groups. All portraits in the collection originate from commercial portrait studios in Brooklyn, N.Y.

The following portrait studios are represented in the collection: Stevenson, N. Augarten, The Duryea, A. Werner, Harry Kopke, H.G. Borgfeldt, Ehm, Henry Holler & Company, Williamsburg Photo Company, Stoffregen, W. Burghardt, Bring's Studio, Fulton Art Studio, and Jeannette Studio.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Based on the date range of this collection, all items will enter the public domain by 2019. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchase from Xerxes Fine Books & Documents, 1986.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn studio portrait collection, V1987.020, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society holds several portrait collections with similar items, including the 19th century Brooklyn cabinet card collection (V1987.021) and the Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr. collection of 19th century Brooklyn portraits (V1988.028). Consult with library staff for more information.
